results.title: Cattle country
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Canada”.
The soil of the foothills of the Rocky Mountains (North America) is ideal for pasture, and the climate is excellently suited to cattle-raising. Modern methods of protecting cattle during winter, how they are treated for warble-fly, methods of breeding, spring migration to fresh grazing lands, mustering for market, and shipping away for sale, are studied on this film of Canadian cattle raising. No credits available.

results.title: Cattle country
results.brief_description: This film provides information on the beef cattle industry in Australia. It presents a general picture of beef cattle types, including the major British breeds, some tropical breeds, and the European exotics, now making their appearance in the country. Intended in particular for students and young farmers. No further credits available.

results.title: Cattle and the corn belt
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth and it’s peoples”.
The Middle West States of America play an important part in producing the country’s meat supply. Here are the cattle buyers and the packing plants, but the cattle business begins in Montana and Wyoming on the cattle ranches. The film shows the annual roundup, the branding, and the shipments of cattle in the fall to the farmers in the corn belt, where they are fattened for market.

results.title: Catskinner Keen
results.creator_credit: Donald Brittain, John Smith and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “West”.
Bob Keen is almost larger than life - big in stature, self-made millionaire, already part of the legend of the Northwest. His fortunes began with a second-hand caterpillar tractor, bulldozing mountain roads. Now he owns - oil land, operates road, water and air transport, flies a plane, drives a chuckwagon, and is listed on the stock exchange. For all that, he’s a modest man who still likes yarning by a campfire with old cowpuncher pals in the big game country of the Rockies. (Award: Hollywood)

results.title: Cats and dogs
results.creator_credit: Paul R. Gurian and Jack Sholder
results.brief_description: The relationship between a man and woman is explored in a series of episodes which reveal much about them and about their attitude to each other. There is both comedy and futility in their arguments - she is concerned with understanding and developing a deeper relationship while he is impatient with her intellectualizing of the situation.

results.title: Cats & dogs = Cats and dogs [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Andrew Lazar, Chris DeFaria, Warren Zide, Craig Perry and Lawrence Guterman
results.brief_description: A young beagle finds himself a player in a canines versus felines war when he is introduced to the Brody family. Now named Lou, he is quickly acquainted with Butch, Chief Agency Dog, who introduces him to fellow agents Peek and Sam, as well as tracing the origins of mission he is now an integral part of - Action Plan Delta. Action Plan Delta comprises of replacing the previous catnapped pet, Buddy, and guarding the Brody home from cat invasion. The cats are intent on entering the household to gain access to a serum Mr Brody has been perfecting - a serum which prevents dog allergies. In the wrong hands (paws), the serum could be reversed and create widespread dog allergies, thus allowing cats to become man’s best friend. Leader of the cat movement is a white feline with the undignified name of Mr Tinkles. When the cats infiltrate the Brody home the dogs cast a vote as to whether they should save family or formula. Featuring impressive special effects, “Cats & dogs” presents an interesting take on the spy/action genre (Mission Impossible in particular), with all that you’d expect to see in such a film: secret agents, Russian spies, inventive weapons and perverse interrogation techniques. It’s also concerned about the love between man and pet - with dogs in particular. Voices provided by Tobey Maguire (Lou), Alec Baldwin (Butch), Sean Hayes (Mr Tinkle), Susan Sarandon (Ivy), Michael Clarke Duncan (Sam) Joe Pantoliano (Peek) and Charlton Heston (the Mastiff). Cast also includes Elizabeth Perkins and Miriam Margolyes. Creature effects by Jim Henson’s Creature Shop.

Episode of Series “Talk to the animals”.

results.title: Cats
results.creator_credit: Alan Degen and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of pets”.
This video explores the life of a housecat, from the time of its birth, through its early months of development to adulthood. It explores a cats ability to always land on its feet, its natural agility and flexibility. Also explained are the cat’s mechanisms of perception and communication; the use of the tongue, specialised scent glands, ears and whiskers and its voice. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teachers guide included.

results.title: Cats
results.creator_credit: Andrew Lloyd Webber, Really Useful Films and David Mallet
results.brief_description: ‘Cats’ is the longest-running musical in the history of the London West End and Broadway Theatre. The musical exploded onto the West End in 1981 and became an instant hit world wide, with “Memory” one of it’s classic and recognisable songs. Based on “Old Possum’s book of practical cats” by T.S. Eliot - CATS is a stunning production with a star studded cast including Elaine Paige and Sir John Mills. The costumes and choreography are superb, effectively transforming humans into felines. Using the latest technology, all the excitement, thrill, romance and intimacy of this theatrical legend is captured on screen. With breathtaking visuals and full digital sound from a 70 piece orchestra, one is lead into the mysterious world of cats.

results.title: Cathy's Child
results.creator_credit: Pam Oliver, Errol Sullivan and Donald Crombie
results.brief_description: In 1973, Cathy Baikas, a Maltese immigrant, contacted “The Sun” newspaper office in Sydney to seek help. Cathy’s Greek-born husband, from whom she was separated, had left for Greece, taking with him their baby daughter. The incident becomes a “cause celebre” and eventually Cathy is given custody of her daughter, and a passport to travel to Greece. With the help of the Australian Consul in Athens she manages to get her daughter back from her husband’s family. Based on “Sun” journalist, Dick Wardley’s book, “A Piece of Paper”. Cast includes Michelle Fawdon, Bryan Brown and Frankie J. Holden.
